DOC.brief_title: Extracolonic Findings Computed Tomography ( CT ) Colonography
DOC.detailed_description: The original ACRIN 6664 National CT Colonography Trial include 15 participate site total study data set 2531 participant . The target study data set ACRIN 7151 trial 520 participant , assign one three cohort : E3/E4 Case Group ( n = 141 ) exclude pulmonary nodule , E3/E4 Pulmonary Nodules Case Group ( n = 119 ) , E1 Control Group ( n = 260 ) ( see Section 8.6 ) . Medical record collect site institution primary care provider identify participant ACRIN 6664 trial . Initial record collection comprise six month follow CTC cohort . Additional medical record collection ( primary care provider , specialist , hospital , extend time period ) may necessary primary endpoint determination . ECFs categorize accord original radiology read CTC ACRIN 6664 trial .
DOC.criteria: No participant subpopulation exclude prior selection ( E1 population match Case Group population ) . Data 15 participate site ACRIN 6664 trial provide study data set 2531 participant , broken total target study data set 520 participant . Participants distribute one three cohort follow : The Case Group target consent 141 participant case indeterminate potentially significant finding ( E3/E4s ) pulmonary nodule . The Pulmonary Nodules Case Group comprise 119 case E3/E4 ECFs characterize pulmonary nodule . The E1 Control Group draw 866 E1 ECF case create cohort 260 E1ECF case . The Control Group comparison Case Group Pulmonary Nodules Case Group select Biostatistics Data Management Center ( BDMC ) . The BDMC match E1 141 control 141 casegroup participant indeterminate potentially significant finding ( E3/E4s ) . The BDMC also match 119 E1 control 119 E3/E4 pulmonary nodule case . Controls match site , age caliper ( 5 year ) , sex possible . Where appropriate match obtain , match criterion relax . If potential participant decline study consent , bestmatch additional case appropriate group maintain target population . Any additional case beyond initial 520 participant identify medical record collection match feasible .
